Title: Flower counting
Description:
- You need to implement a method for counting the number of colors.
 The number of colors is passed as input - the result of previous calculations. You need to return this value increased by one.
Tips: Just increase oldCount by 1 and bring it back! :)

Title: Correct title
Description: - You are given 4 variables with different names. You must select and return the value of the variable with the most correct (in terms of C# code-style) name.
Tips: If you need to, read in the reference book about the best way to name variables.

Title: Round
Description:
- You need to count the number of apples in the baskets.
 There are very small fruits among the fruits that would be correctly counted as part of an apple, but unfortunately, the module you use for calculations only accepts whole numbers. Round up the value to an integer with Math.Round() and cast it to an integer using (int).
 Use CountModule.Count(int count) to populate the results.
Tips: Declare a new variable and assign a value to it Math.Round(...).
Instead of ellipses write the argument of the current method.
Use an explicit ghost so that the value of your variable is of int type.
At the end, call the CountModule.Count method and pass it your variable as argument.

Title: Binary to decimal.
Description: - You need to implement a method that processes the current digit of a binary number to convert it to decimal. You are given a digit of a binary number (digit) and its ordinal number (number).
Tips: The reference book has an algorithm for converting a number to another number system. You only need to translate one digit.

Title: Get rid of the log
Description:
- You have to implement a method that removes an obstacle in the form of a log. You can do this using the methods of sequential use of the TakeLog, MoveLog, PutLog methods.
 Each of them accepts an object (log) that needs to be manipulated.
Tips: Pass log as an argument to each.
